definitions: To extract something, especially money or information, from someone by persistent effort or by taking advantage of them.
To live off another person or organization by relying on them for support or resources, often in a parasitic way.
To drain or draw off a liquid from a substance.
examples: He tried to leech money from his wealthy aunt.
The struggling artist continued to leech off his parents.
The process will leech out the impurities from the solution.
